title: How did the Nazis kill the innocent people? - Quora

response.answer_text: Honestly, I do not know what you mean when you say "innocent people". Partisans and terrorists were harmless and inoffensive saints? Perhaps the saboteurs? The murderers of unarmed soldiers? It is difficult to specify -for a Soldier- when someone shoots you, is throwing explosives, or blows up the vehicle where you are driving ... if your enemy is an “innocent angel”.  If for a court of justice it is difficult to issue a fair verdict, imagine that you have no judges to turn to when they are attacking you.  In the 2nd World War, there are not -in fact- completely innocent parties. The Jews had been accustomed I.E. by belonging to the resistance in all countries where Germany set foot.  Assassinating at discretion everything that was Teutonic or wear uniform. It was a characteristic of that people until they themselves became occupying armies when they obtained their State of Israel in Palestine ... using the same defensive methods as the Germans at the time when they had to defend themselves from their subversive activities. SOURCES: A resistance fighter preparing a bomb on train tracks in France; 1944: Joseph Epstein, Polish Communist French Resistance hero; Armed Resistance & Background: Resistance
How did the Nazis kill the innocent people? Surely you mean the ALLIES. THEY killed FAR more innocent people than the Germans.
Zyklon B, bullets, bombs of varying sizes, more Zyklon B, more bullets, vivisections, exhaust and exhaustion, starvation, torture, hanging, beheading, “medical experiments”, euthanasia, beatings.
Cyanide gas was the most cost effective method. The gas they used was a concentrated insect killer called Zyklon-B.
Shooting, starving, gasing, and many more. There are a lot of ways to kill people, its not like they only used one option.
